articles.author: Bart Meijer, Dominique Vidalon
articles.description: Rubio's comments underline mounting frustrations in the White House over a lack of progress in pushes to settle a growing list of geopolitical challenges.
articles.title: US will abandon Ukraine peace efforts if no progress made soon, Rubio says

articles.author: Anastasiia Malenko, Christian Lowe
articles.description: Kyiv said on Friday it aims to complete talks by the end of next week about a deal with Washington on jointly exploiting Ukrainian mineral resources, an agreement Ukrainian officials hope will go some way to firming up softening U.S. support for them in their war with Russia.
articles.title: Ukraine says aiming to wrap up mineral deal talks within a week

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: A Russian drone strike early on Friday hit a bakery in northern Ukraine where traditional Easter cakes were being prepared, killing one man, Ukrainian officials said.
articles.title: Russian drone hits bakery preparing Easter cakes, killing one, Kyiv says

articles.author: Hannah Lang, Judith Langowski
articles.description: Last week, a pack of rice crackers at Sun Vin Grocery store on Mulberry Street in New York City’s Chinatown cost $4.99.
articles.title: Insight: In US Chinatowns, merchants ‘don’t want the trade war to be a war’

articles.author: Trevor Hunnicutt
articles.description: Trump's comments further pointed to a diminished appetite for sharply higher across-the-board tariffs on dozens of countries after markets reacted violently to their introduction on April 2.
articles.title: Trump signals tit-for-tat China tariffs may be near end; TikTok deal on ice

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: Israeli airstrikes hit around 40 targets across the Gaza Strip over the past day, the military said on Friday, hours after Hamas rejected an Israeli ceasefire offer that it said fell short of its demand to agree a full end to the war.
articles.title: Israeli strikes hit dozens of targets in Gaza as ceasefire efforts stall

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: U.S. strikes on a fuel port in Yemen killed at least 38 people on Thursday, Houthi-run media said, one of the deadliest days since the United States began its attacks on the Iran-backed militants.
articles.title: US strike on Yemen fuel port kills at least 38, Houthi media say

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: Ukraine imposed sanctions on three Chinese companies on Friday, a day after President Volodymyr Zelenskiy alleged that China had been supplying weapons to Russia.
articles.title: Ukraine hits Chinese firms with sanctions after accusing Beijing of arming Russia

articles.author: Ali Sawafta, James Mackenzie
articles.description: Fatima Abu Naim, a mother of five, lives in a hillside cave in the occupied West Bank, under increasing pressure from Jewish settlers who, she says, try to steal her family's sheep and come by regularly to tell her and her husband to leave.
articles.title: Herders under growing pressure as West Bank settlers encroach on grazing land

articles.author: Panu Wongcha-Um
articles.description: Myanmar's junta and a key opposition group have indicated they will extend a ceasefire to support more aid efforts after a devastating earthquake, Malaysia's Prime Minister Anwar Ibrahim said on Friday, following rare high-level talks with the ruling military.
articles.title: Myanmar junta, opposition set to extend ceasefire, Malaysia PM says
